channel.title: dissensus.ai | Governance Alignment Research
channel.description: Research updates from Dissensus - formalizing productive friction in multi-agent systems.

item.title: The Replicator-Optimization Mechanism - arXiv Submission
item.description: A unified computational framework for self-replicating, optimization-executing systems across physical and abstract substrates. Submitted to arXiv and under review at Synthese.

item.title: Stakes Without Voice - New Working Paper
item.description: Structural exclusion and the legitimacy deficit problem. When stakeholders bear costs but lack representation in governance decisions.

item.title: Identity is Irreducibly Relational
item.description: Ontological foundations for relational functionalism. Why identity cannot be reduced to intrinsic properties.

item.title: Consciousness as Nominalization Error
item.description: Why the hard problem dissolves under linguistic analysis. Consciousness is a process noun mistaken for an entity noun.

item.title: Dissensus Research Lab Launched
item.description: Official launch of dissensus.ai - a governance alignment research lab focused on adversarial systems and multi-agent friction dynamics.

item.title: The Doctrine of Consensual Sovereignty
item.description: Quantifying legitimacy in adversarial environments. Introduces stakes-weighted consent alignment as a formal measure of political legitimacy.

item.title: Dissolving Qualia via Occam's Razor
item.description: Eliminative monism and the computational basis of phenomenological illusion. A ~33,000 word monograph on consciousness.
